title: Fix Frozen UI State with try/catch/finally

requirements.summary: Wrap the backend.start_boardroom_debate() call in handleTranscriptComplete with a try/catch/finally block to handle connection failures
acceptanceCriteria: The backend.start_boardroom_debate() call is wrapped in a try block
A catch block is present to handle any thrown errors

file_operations.description: Wrap the backend.start_boardroom_debate() call inside the handleTranscriptComplete function with a try block to isolate the async operation and prepare for error handling

requirements.summary: Add console.error logging in the catch block to capture connection issues or errors from the backend call
acceptanceCriteria: console.error is called in the catch block with error details
Error information is visible in browser console for debugging

file_operations.description: Add a catch block to the try/catch structure in handleTranscriptComplete that logs errors using console.error, capturing any connection issues or backend call failures for debugging purposes

requirements.summary: Reset the debating/loading state to false in the finally block to re-enable the Push-to-Talk button after errors
acceptanceCriteria: The finally block executes regardless of success or failure
The debating state is reset to false in the finally block
The Push-to-Talk button becomes enabled again after an error occurs
UI does not remain frozen when backend calls fail

file_operations.description: Add a finally block to the try/catch structure in handleTranscriptComplete that unconditionally resets the debating state (setIsDebating(false)) to ensure the Push-to-Talk button is re-enabled regardless of whether the backend call succeeds or fails, preventing frozen UI states
